section.title: Concept Details
section.para: A Concept represents a clinical meaning. Each Concept has descriptions that describe the concept, relationships that relate concepts to each other, and OWL axioms that provide a logical definition to the concept. The logical definition (axiom) is used by the Classifier to infer additional relationships between concepts – this is known as the inferred axiom.

In Concept Details a user can view concept information, modify display options, create a child concept, edit the concept, clone the concept, view value set membership, and display history of a concept. When a user selects a concept from the taxonomy, search results, or the briefcase, its information is displayed in the Concept Details pane. Refer to for an example of the information displayed.
The sections below describe the concept information displayed and the functions available in the Concept Details pane.

section.title: Available Actions
section.para:
There are several actions available in Concept Details pane:
Link – the Concept Details pane can be "linked" with the Taxonomy or "unlinked" by toggling the linkage icon (refer to )
New Child Concept – a new concept is created with the currently selected concept as its parent.
Edit Concept – enables the displayed concept to be modified.
Clone – copies the displayed concept to a new concept template.
Display Options - changes the display options for the Concept Details pane, refer to . Certain information can be hidden or shown using these options.
Close – closes the Concept Details pane. Select a concept from the taxonomy tab to reopen a concept details pane.
Context Menu – the Context Menu is also available in Concept Details by right-clicking on the concept name in the upper left, see . For a description of the functions available in the Context Menu, refer to

section.title: General Info
section.para:
The General Info tab has three sections: concept properties, descriptions, and axiom. This view is configured with default display options
See . :
Concept Properties
Concept Type – there are two types of concepts: primitive or defined, refer to
Status – defines whether the concept is active or inactive
Module – identifies the module in which the concept belongs (e.g. a SNOMED CT concept is in SNOMED CT core module)
Terminology ID - if the concept is a SNOMED concept then the SCTID is displayed. If the concept is a LOINC term, the LOINC ID is displayed.
Fully Qualified Name (FQN) – the human readable unique word or phrase which represents clinical meaning.
Regular Name –
a term of a specified type that describes the concept; a concept can have more than one Regular Name.

section.para:
The Value Sets

section.title: CSV
section.para:
Selecting the CSV Export
A Comma Separated Values file is a plain text file that contains a list of data.button will download a CSV formatted file with term, terminology id, status, and module for each Value Set listed.

section.title: Members
section.para: The Members tab is available when a concept is a Value Set concept. The concepts that are members of the Wound Color Reference Set are displayed in the table. In this case the Wound Color Reference Set has 3 members. A user can add the members to the briefcase by selecting Add all to Briefcase or by selecting briefcase icon in the table row. In addition, a CSV file can be downloaded. See .
